taskGroup.name: NCD Data Reduction Tutorial
taskGroup.intro: This is compilation of tutorials on various tasks related to NCD data reduction in SDA.

taskGroup.name: Setup for NCD Data Reduction
taskGroup.intro: This group of tasks we import data into NCD perspective and configure detector settings.

task.name: Importing data into SDA workbench
task.intro: In this section We need to create a data project pointing to /dls/sci-scratch/ExampleData/NCDExamples directory.

task.name: Loading Detector Information
task.intro: In this section we set Pilatus2M as SAXS detector and Scaler as detector for data normalisation.

taskGroup.name: Running NCD Data Reduction
taskGroup.intro: This group of tasks describes procedures for calibrating SAXS detector, creating detector mask and running data reduction process

task.name: Calibrating SAXS detector
task.intro:
These tutorials present SAXS detector calibration procedure. Following files will be needed to complete these task:
i22-34820.nxs - Ag Behenate calibration file. It has four circles that correspond to first four calibration peaks.

task.name: Setting Detector Mask
task.intro: Pilatus2M has inactive grid area where pixels are assigned value of -1. Masking tool allows us to disregard such pixels for 1D profile calculations.

task.name: Basic NCD Data Reduction
task.intro:
These tutorials present basic NCD data reduction workflow. Following files will be needed to complete these task:
i22-34770.nxs - File with background data.
i22-34639.nxs - File to be used as a detector response data.
i22-34774.nxs - File with sample data that we want to process. It is recommended to select only part of dataset frames as processing the whole dataset can take 10-15min.

taskGroup.name: Other Features
taskGroup.intro: These tutorials present some other features that could be useful for NCD data processing.

task.name: Restoring Data from Processing Results
task.intro:
Results file that has q-axis calibration and/or mask information can be used to load this data back into NCD perspective for processing data.
results_Pilatus2M_050112_154741_i22-34774.nxs - Example of processing results file for frames 50-60 with q-axis calibration and detector mask data.

task.name: Advanced Slicing and Averaging Techniques
task.intro: Some data files contain multidimensional datasets obtained using e.g. grid scans. This tutorial explains how user can process only a subset of available data and average it over multiple dimensions.
